**Purpose**: Rich library component for rendering horizontal rules (divider lines) in console output with optional titles and styling.

## Core Class

**Rule (L12-115)**: Console renderable that draws horizontal lines with optional embedded text titles. Inherits from `JupyterMixin` for Jupyter notebook compatibility.

### Constructor (L23-44)
- **Parameters**: `title` (str/Text), `characters` (str, default "─"), `style` (str/Style), `end` (str), `align` (AlignMethod)
- **Validation**: Ensures characters have cell width ≥1, validates alignment values ("left", "center", "right")
- **Storage**: Direct assignment of all parameters to instance attributes

### Key Methods

**__rich_console__ (L49-103)**: Primary rendering logic
- Handles ASCII-only mode fallback (L54-58)
- Two rendering paths: title-less rules (L61-63) vs titled rules (L65-103)
- Title processing: converts strings to Text objects, normalizes whitespace (L70-71)
- Alignment algorithms:
  - Center: Calculates side widths, creates left/right rule segments (L80-90)
  - Left: Title followed by rule characters (L91-95)
  - Right: Rule characters followed by title (L96-100)
- Uses `set_cell_size` for width normalization (L102)

**_rule_line (L105-109)**: Generates simple horizontal line without title
- Repeats characters to fill width, truncates excess, normalizes cell size

**__rich_measure__ (L111-114)**: Returns fixed measurement (1,1) for layout calculations

## Dependencies
- `cells.cell_len, set_cell_size`: Unicode cell width handling
- `text.Text`: Rich text object for styling
- `console.Console, ConsoleOptions, RenderResult`: Rich console framework
- `align.AlignMethod`: Type for alignment options

## Architectural Patterns
- Rich console renderable protocol implementation
- Cell-width aware text processing for proper Unicode/CJK character handling
- Flexible alignment with proportional space distribution
- ASCII fallback for compatibility

## Demo Script (L117-130)
Simple command-line demonstration accepting title from argv, showing basic usage patterns.
